Fields.DialogueText: Heave HO! My CREW! You all know what to DO! Gimme an "F!" Gimme an "I!" Gimme a "G-H-T!" Tell me three times, shout for me!
Ahem... I know you're there, Captain.
And?
Give it to me!

Fields.MenuText: Give you what? I don't understand.
"FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT!"
I could give you a trip to sickbay for going insane. Would that work?

Fields.DialogueText: A cheer, Captain... I was just trying to get you to cheer the word "fight" for me.
Yes! That's the sprit, Captain!
Ha! You have a strange sense of humor sometimes, Captain.
I'll never doubt your dedication to the crew's morale, Stewart...
Thanks!
But I do question your dedication to the navigation brief. That's why I'm down here looking for you.
Sorry! I lost track of time while I was practicing my cheers.
*ALARM*
Hooray!
You're happy? That alarm means Morganas have been spotted!
That's right! Now I'm not late to a navigation brief – I'm right on time for a FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT!
@BATTLE
Oh. Is it too late to...
Don't worry about it. Maybe next time!
Lookout duty?! I hardly think that's fair, sir!
It's fair if I say it is, Stewart.
For a bit of tardiness? Sure, I lost track of time and ran a few minutes late... but technically, I didn't miss the navigation brief!
Only because the Morganas attacked.
I got carried away while I was working on something to help the crew. Should I really be punished for that?

Fields.MenuText: It's not punishment, Stewart.
You've made your case, but I still make the decisions, Stewart.
Maybe you're right. I'm overreacting. Just don't be late in the future.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? Golly, sir, it sure does FEEL like punishment, though.
Yes, Captain. I suppose it won't be so bad...
Thanks, Cap! You can be sure I won't be there! I mean... be late! You can be sure I'll always be late!
Get out there and stand some lookout. Maybe a bit of fresh air will help.
Oh! I suddenly remembered something!
What's that?
I remembered that I LIKE standing lookout duty!
*sigh*
Oh! And just in time, too! See those little specks off the starboard beam? BF coming over the horizon, Captain!
@BATTLE
AUUGGHHHHH what am I saying?!
Oh! Captain, you're here! Listen to a cheer I just wrote!
"A! I! R! Feel the BREEZE! Fresh air on the sev-en SEAS!"
Sounds like you're in fine form, Stewart. How's morale?
Couldn't be better! While I was topside, standing lookout duty, the fresh air really lifted my spirits.

Fields.MenuText: I love the fresh air, too.
It smells a lot better than the boiler rooms, that's for sure.
Are you sure it's just fresh air you've been enjoying?

Fields.DialogueText: Who doesn't? I'd wonder about somebody who hated fresh air!
I'll try not to take that personally.
Hahahahaha! Wait... what?
Too bad that we can't have fresh air everywhere inside the ship.
We're a warship, not a cruise barge, Stewart.
Oh... that gives me an idea...
Not now.
Hear me out! I think that-
We've got visitors!
Let's fight them off quickly, Captain. I won't want the stink of Morganas ruining my fresh air!
@BATTLE
Why is it so chilly back here? Do we have a ventilation problem?
Hm...
What's this? All the portholes in the starboard crew spaces are open...
That's right, Captain! ALL of them are open! Oh, plus I've got every window on the port side open, too.
Oh?
Fresh air!

Fields.MenuText: Shut them all, Stewart. I'd prefer to avoid freezing on my own ship.
Well done! These passageways were starting to smell a bit ripe.
Some of these portholes are close to the waterline, especially astern.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye aye, Captain.
Thanks! That's why I did it!
You're not afraid of a few puddles, are you? Need my galoshes?
Getting some fresh air topside boosted my spirits so much, Captain, and I wanted to share that with the crew.
Not everybody gets to work topside. That's thoughtful of you, Stewart, to try and get them some fresh air. Unusual, but thoughtful.
Smell that? Coming through the portholes?
Fresh air and sea spray?
No, something not so nice as that... smells like Morganas!
Are you sure?
Gimme an "M!" Gimme an "O!" Gimme an "R!"...
I'll take that as a yes. Let's get to battle stations, Stewart!
@BATTLE
No, thanks.
We've gotten most of the water out of the crew berthing spaces, Stewart.
And the provision stores?
Dry as a bone, ma'am. Bilges are pumped down, as well.
Excellent! Thank you, sailor.
Hello, Captain! I'm happy to report we've got all of the water out of the ship.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe next time you'll be more careful with keeping the windows open. We took on a lot of water because of all those open portholes.
The crew seems cheerful, even though it took hours to clean up all of that water.
What a mess. I hope you learned your lesson.

Fields.DialogueText: Live and learn, Captain!
Everybody worked hard, but you know me! I kept their spirits up while they worked.
I did, Captain... and I won't let it happen again, I promise.
Even though we had to clean up some water, the crew appreciated the fresh air.
Stuck every day in a smelly engine room or sharing berthing with another sailor's dirty socks... yuck!
So... you're saying you'd do it again?
*ALARM*
Think carefully about that answer. For now, let's get to battle stations!
@BATTLE
We've almost arrived at the waypoint, Captain. Standing by to maneuver to the east on your mark.
Navigator, did you just say east?
That's right, Stewart. The patrol's next leg takes us on course zero nine zero.
Oh, really?
Did I say something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all, Navigator. Stand by for the turn.
That course checks with our charts.
Anything to say to that, Stewart?

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed.
It can wait.
Mark the turn. Stewart, right full rudder. Steady course zero nine zero.
Stewart?
Oh! Zero nine zero, aye. We're coming about now.
I need to verify the gyro. By your leave, Captain.
Very well, Navigator.
Homesick?
I wouldn't say homesick... but...
Want to talk about it? We've got a few minutes before the intelligence briefing.
*ALARM*
Maybe later, Captain! Right now, we've got BF inbound!
@BATTLE
Stewart, report to the bridge.
Reporting as ordered. I have the intelligence report from the radio room for you, Captain.
We don't have much time before contact with the enemy. Summarize the intelligence report for me, Stewart.
Huh?
The report? The one you just read?
Oh... I, um, I read it, but...

Fields.MenuText: Did something distract you?
But you wanted me to read it for myself? All right...
You probably just skimmed it, right? I do that, too, sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess so. I think so.
Um... yes! Yes, that's it. I've read the report, but you really should read it for yourself.
Thanks for being so understanding.
Just hand it to me, and we'll read it together as quickly as we can.
Right! Good idea, Captain!
It says that-
*ALARM*
Damn! Sorry, Captain, but we're out of time! Morgana contacts coming over the horizon!
I'll have to read the report later, I guess. Guns up, Stewart.
Aye aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
I don't see it yet, Stewart. Am I pointed the right way?
Turn to the left a bit. See the cloud that looks like an elephant? Now look just behind it... see it yet?
Ha! There it is! It really DOES look like the Captain's face! Right down to the-
Ahem.
Oh! I think I heard somebody call my name. Excuse me, Captain!
Dismissed, Lieutenant.
Hello!

Fields.MenuText: Don't "hello" me, Stewart.
Having a good time?
Does that cloud really look like me?

Fields.DialogueText: Geez, Captain, it was just a bit of fun.
Yes!
Not really, but I was trying to make a game out of it.
The Lieutenant was feeling blue, and I was trying to cheer her up a bit. It's what I do!
I'm well aware, and I'm grateful for how much you care about the crew - but I do find your techniques confusing sometimes.
If it helps, nobody was making fun of you, Captain. We were just admiring the clouds.
How about those clouds over there? The ones near the horizon? They look a bit like...
Like smoke from Morganas! Good eye, sir!
@BATTLE
Am I supposed to knock first, or do I just walk in?
This isn't your first time stopping by my stateroom, Stewart.
True, but when you told me to come over and talk to you... it felt like maybe I was in trouble. Is this about the clouds?
You're not in trouble.
Still feels that way... Uh-oh... I'm getting nervous! When I get nervous, sometimes I start feeling the urge to...
To what?
Gimme a "U!" Gimme an "S!" Gimme an "A! A! A!" The stars and stripes will win to-DAY!
I don't think it's a good time to start cheering...
POUR a round of DRINKS and RAISE your GLASS! SHOOT a Morgana in her smelly old-

Fields.MenuText: That's enough! I understand perfectly fine. You start cheering when you get nervous.
Center of mass?
Keep going!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh. Right. Hee hee! Sorry, Captain.
That's not really how the cheer normally goes, Captain.
On second thought, maybe I'll stop there.
You called me here to talk, not for a cheer. What are we talking about today?
You've been distracted, and it's affecting your performance. What's the matter?
Any time we turn east, I'm reminded how long it's been since I was home. I haven't seen America since 1922!
So, you're homesick?
Yes, but that's not really the problem.
I'm still confused, Stewart.
When's the last time you were home, Captain? Or any of the crew? When I'm reminded of home, I can't help but think of what it's like for everybody.
Admirable, Stewart, truly... but our ship still needs a Belle that can focus. Can you?
Yes! I can. Oh, and I'll make it up to the crew for getting distracted. I've got a great idea for-
*ALARM*
Hold that thought, Stewart. Hurry to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Suit yourself.
Hop in my BUCKET and don't be SHY! We need more FISH for a tasty fish FRY!
Fishing on your time off, I see. Catch anything good, Stewart?
Quite a lot, actually! I think I'll catch enough for the whole crew to enjoy a great meal. Want to help me?

Fields.MenuText: Sure! I love fishing.
Do I have to put the worms on the hook? I don't like that part.
I'd rather see you inspecting our guns and keeping us ready for the next fight with the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: I was hoping you'd say that! I could use the company out here.
Just leave that to me! I don't mind it at all.
When it comes to fighting, a good meal is just as important for the crew.
Seafood is so wonderful, don't you think? After spending so much time in the Pacific, I developed a big appetite for fresh fish.
And here you are, topside, trying to catch something nice for the crew to enjoy. No wonder they like you so much.
I do what I can to keep their morale up. If they can't go home to be with their loved ones, at least I can give them a nice dinner.
You talk a lot about going home, lately.
Home is always on my mind, Captain. I'd be lying if I said I didn't miss seeing the USA. A nice, long stay in an American port would be...
Want to talk about it right now?
Maybe later. For now, I'd like to keep fishing. I feel like I'm about to catch a big one!
That isn't a fish...
@BATTLE
I'm positively stuffed! I must have eaten a ton of that fish that Stewart caught for us!
Oh? Then why are you back in line, Lieutenant?
I might be able to eat a little more...
You'll burst the buttons off your uniform if you keep going.
That's a risk I'm willing to take. Oh, and don't think I'm going to let you cut ahead of me in line!
Eat up! We caught plenty of fish... but leave room for a stiff drink to help it go down later, all right?
Don't have to tell us twice, ma'am!
Did you try the fish yet, Captain? What do you think of it?

Fields.MenuText: I think it's delicious, Stewart.
I think the crew is going to eat themselves sick.
I think you're doing a great job keeping the crew happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Wonderful! That's all I needed to hear.
Oh? I'll ask the cooks to serve smaller portions, then.
Thank you!
Morganas don't stand a chance against a well-fed and happy crew!
*ALARM*
You just HAD to tempt fate, didn't you?
Don't worry, crew! I'll save the rest as leftovers... and drinks after we win!
@BATTLE
Hang on! We've got Morganas coming straight for us!
All hands to battlestations, Stewart.
@BATTLE
Having trouble getting some sleep, Captain?
That obvious, huh?
Since the battle, we've walked by each other four times in the passageways now. Anybody can tell you've been feeling restless.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's indigestion from that big fish dinner.
I just have a lot on my mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... Sorry about that, sir.
If there's anything I can do to cheer you up, just let me know.
You don't have to talk about it, sir.
Maybe a lullaby cheer would help you get some rest.
A lullaby cheer? How does that work?
I don't know. I've never cheered one before, but maybe if I try hard enough I can figure it out. Let's see...
Um...
"We want some SLEEP and we're gonna go to BED! Cover that pillow with our big fat HEAD!"
Gosh... it, uh, seems to be working.
Really?!
Oh, um, yes! Absolutely... I'm, uh, going to my cabin right now before I fall asleep right here on the deck.
Wonderful news! So glad I could help!
Right... excuse me, Stewart.
BYE! Oops... sorry for yelling just now. Sweet dreams!
And this one's a picture of my daughter and my son. See?
Oh, I certainly see the resemblance. They have your smile, for sure!
I wonder how much bigger they'll both be when I get home...
Kids grow up fast, but those smiles won't change.
Thanks, Stewart.
The crew thinks about their families at home quite a lot, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: That's who we're really fighting for, if you ask me.
Looking at photos all the time is a distraction. On this warship, I'd rather have the crew thinking about their jobs.
Not every kid takes a good-looking picture. Be honest, how ugly were those children?

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed!
In moderation, I think it motivates the crew to work harder.
Ha! I'll admit that I've seen cuter ones... but please don't be cruel to your own crew!
If you're done talking to the crew, let's get moving. We've got some reports that we might see increased Morgana activity in our patrol area.
Let's hit them on the high seas and keep them away from the shores, then!
That's the spirit, Stewart.
Oh, I've got plenty of THAT!
@BATTLE
Terrible news! Captain, did you see the reports from HQ?
The last few messages hinted that we might have something big coming, but they never said what to expect. Is it bad?
It's the worst! Morganas in our region are focusing shore attacks... with civilian targets.

Fields.MenuText: Favoring civilian targets over military targets is a strategic mistake. It provokes us without hurting our ability to fight.
Maybe they want to lure us away from something else by threatening our families.
Going after non-combatants is despicable!

Fields.DialogueText: I guess that's one way to look at it...
If so, it's working! Let me at 'em!
Morganas are truly vile...
Captain, please tell me that you'll volunteer us! I want to protect those people!
No promises, Stewart, but I'll see what I can do.
All right... but please hurry. I don't know how long I can wait.
A little longer, at least. We have to take care of something else first.
What's that, Captain?
Take my binoculars and look for yourself...
BF sighted!
@BATTLE
I can sense them, Captain. We've got Morganas coming over the horizon, I'm sure of it!
Get your guns ready!
@BATTLE
I've got the after-action reports ready to transmit, Captain. Anything else on your desk for me to take to radio?
I don't think so, but feel free to look.
What's this? Oh! You didn't finish your paperwork for the cruise book, Captain. You still have some blanks to fill in.
I've been busy keeping HQ updated with our Morgana contacts lately. Some of my other paperwork has fallen off, I'm afraid.
Cruise books are important for morale, and you know how I feel about that! Maybe I can help. How about the biography section? I'll fill it in for you.
Biography section?
Let's see. Job? Ship's captain, of course! That's easy. Hometown? Interesting... Say, Captain, what sort of place was your hometown?

Fields.MenuText: A big city. Lots of people, lots of traffic.
A small town. It was kind of remote.
Hometown? Oh, I was raised by wolves in the wilderness, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds exciting!
That sounds peaceful.
I'm not writing that down! Unless it's true. It's not true, is it? No... of course not...
I notice that you don't talk much about home, Captain.
Maybe another time, all right?
I'd look forward to that!
Morgana forces spotted, Captain. Here they come!
@BATTLE
Damage reports are in, Captain. The Morganas haven't found a way to sink us yet!
That's one way of looking at it. You've got a tough hull, Stewart.
And a tough crew.

Fields.MenuText: I agree. They're well-trained and never shy from a fight.
No crew is perfect, but I wouldn't trade them for anything.
That look on your face means you have something more to say about the matter.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true, but I do have a concern about them...
Neither would I! But I do have a concern about them...
I do have a concern about them...
I know they're strong, but I always think about morale. I want to keep them in great spirits.
And something is threatening that?
I have my suspicions. Some of them seem to be getting homesick, showing me a lot of their pictures and keepsakes.
That can weigh on somebody's mind.
Maybe if I come up with a great cheer...
I'll trust your instincts on this one, Stewart. Thanks for bringing it to my attention.
You're always welcome, Captain!
Another update on the Morgana raids, Stewart. We've got reports that many of the people are refusing to evacuate from the threatened cities.
But they'll be in grave danger if the Morganas attack!
Not much we can do about it until we get there, ma'am.
I suppose so, Lieutenant.
We should head for the cities immediately and evacuate them, don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: They'll evacuate when the threat gets closer.
If they don't evacuate, it's not really our fault.
Can you carry an entire city on this ship?

Fields.DialogueText: I hope so...
They don't want to leave their homes...
I guess not...
I'll chew my fingernails to pieces until HQ gives us the order to help out.
I understand, Stewart. Just keep us on mission until we get orders, all right? We've got plenty of Morganas to deal with out here, too.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Is it true, Lieutenant? The BF is menacing a bunch of coastal towns?
That's the latest intelligence from HQ, yes. I wouldn't be surprised if we got orders to-
Attention on deck! Hello, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Enjoying the latest scuttlebutt?
Hello to you, too.
How are you two doing today?

Fields.DialogueText: We weren't gossiping, Captain. We were just discussing some... recent speculations.
Us? Oh. Fine. We're fine. And the ship is in great shape, Captain.
You both look like you've got something on your minds. What's wrong?
Nothing to report, Captain.
Not a single thing.
Nothing to worry about, Captain.
I'm not convinced that-
*ALARM*
Make way! Time to get loud with my 76-millimeters!
Good to see some hustle... Come on, Lieutenant! Let's get to the bridge.
@BATTLE
Reporting as -- slurrrrp! -- as ordered, Captain.
Sorry to interrupt your noodles, Stewart, but I needed to talk to you about the crew.
If you don't mind the smell of the oyster sauce on my lo mein, I won't mind eating it! Yum... But what was it you wanted to talk about?
I've noticed that the crew is gossiping about the Morganas offensive against coastal cities.
I've noticed it, too.

Fields.MenuText: The situation is making them think about their own hometowns. We need to reassure them.
They must be anxious to render aid to those people. We need to help them settle down.
The gossip has become a distraction. They need to quit it and concentrate on their duties.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent insight! I've actually reached the same conclusion, Captain.
I'll admit – I'm worried about them, too.
I must respectfully disagree, Captain. I think we'd be making a mistake to ignore their concerns.
Even if many of our sailors are from somewhere else, we can't ignore the danger here. Any Morgana threat is a threat to us all.
A homesick and anxious crew won't fight at full strength. If HQ needs us to assist, I want to bring our best. Can you recommend a course of action for us?
I've got a great idea. How about-
*ALARM*
No time, Stewart. Brief me after we deal with these Morganas on our patrol.
I hope I've got enough time to finish my lo mein!
Finish it on your way to the bridge. Battlestations, Stewart!
@BATTLE
Is it true, then? Did we get new orders?
I heard the same rumor. Is HQ tasking us for coastal defense?
With your permission, Captain?
Go ahead, Stewart. Please brief the crew on our orders.
Fleet HQ has terminated our current patrol in the Western Pacific and directed us towards the coast. Specifically, we're headed to defend Shanghai!
I see.
Oh.

Fields.MenuText: I know you miss your homes, but we still have more work to do. The war isn't over yet.
You may miss your homes -- but these people are in danger of losing theirs for good.
We'll protect Shanghai. Maybe you're not from Shanghai... but you'll fight for it like it like it's your own hometown!

Fields.DialogueText: Um... that's true, Captain. Every fight we win gets us closer to the end of the war and keeps our  own homes safer.
That's right, Captain! We'll do our best to help them!
Every city is somebody's home! And this city needs us to help.
I feel a cheer coming on... I don't know if I can help myself!
Go for it, Stewart!
Our ship won't stop 'till we win the FIGHT! Our guns don't quit with Morganas in our SIGHTS!
For SHANGHAI!
Oh! That reminds me! While we're in Shanghai, we should get some xiaolongbao and some steamed crab, too.
Steamed crab!
Really, if you haven't tried Shanghai crab-
*ALARM*
Battlestations!
*RUMBLE*
Great. Now I've got to fight Morganas with a growling stomach...
@BATTLE
Report those new contacts, Stewart.
Contacts identified as Morgana ships, Captain. Let's get to battlestations!
@BATTLE
Enough harassment and delays from these hags! We need to get moving!
Engine room reports that we're ready to answer all bells, Captain.
Very well. Full speed ahead, Stewart. Steady on course two seven zero.
Aye aye, Captain! Making best cruising speed. Think we'll be able to intercept the Morganas before they can threaten Shanghai?

Fields.MenuText: We can do it. We have to do it.
Without more accurate intelligence from HQ, I'm not sure.
I'd hate to see how bad the destruction might be if we don't.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree completely!
I know one thing for sure. We're going to do everything we can.
I can make a good guess about that.
I've seen cities devastated before, Captain. Morganas would hit those families in Shanghai like a force of nature...
Good point. Lieutenant?
Yes, Captain?
Tell the engine room we need to sprint to Shanghai, and we'll worry about fuel later. Flank speed.
All ahead flank, aye aye, Captain.
All RIGHT!
Starboard quarter, Stewart! Visual contact, Morganas spotted astern, target angle zero two zero.
Zero two zero? You did it, Stewart! We beat the Morganas to Shanghai.
If the BF wants to attack that city, they'll have to get through us first!
Whew! All that sprinting has me winded...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we pushed too hard. Showing up to a fight when we're already tired puts us in danger.
Justified. It was the only way to beat the Morganas here.
Don't quit now!

Fields.DialogueText: And risk being late? I think we made the right decision.
I couldn't agree... more... WHEW!
Gimme an "GO!" Gimme a "FIGHT!" Gimme a... gimme a... gimme a cup of coffee...
We kept the Morganas out of range of the city for now. That's all that matters.
You know what IS in range right now, Captain?
*BOOM*
Um...
*BOOM*
US!
@BATTLE
Closer? Are you sure, Captain!
You heard me, Lieutenant. Engage the Morganas to keep them as far from the city as possible. If they get close enough to bombard Shanghai with their guns-
All those people...
We'll keep them out of range, Captain. I'd rather prevent a disaster than pick up the pieces after letting one happen.
Why didn't more civilians evacuate Shanghai when they heard the BF was coming?

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes the old and the infirm physically can't relocate.
Maybe some of them didn't get the news in time.
Home is too important for some people to abandon, even when it's dangerous.

Fields.DialogueText: And then their families stay in the danger with them...
That's true...
That's certainly true...
Or maybe they heard we were coming to protect them, and they know we can DO IT!
Well...
Hey! It's... it's not impossible! I've been around the Western Pacific for a long time, Captain. They know me around here!
Ha! Then let's keep your name in good standing, Stewart!
@BATTLE
Shift in the Morgana formation, Captain! They're regrouping for another push.
How much longer can we hold them off?
We chased them away from the fishing fleets and the evacuating sailboats. At least we know we helped them get away safely.

Fields.MenuText: We can take comfort in that, I suppose.
That's not good enough. We still have vulnerable people in those city buildings.
That will sound nice on our tombstones...

Fields.DialogueText: But we're not done yet, Captain!
We've got plenty of fight left, Captain!
Don't talk like that, Captain! We're not done yet!
We've got a hundred times more heart than those BF hags. If we smash through this formation one more time, I think we'll turn them away for good.
That's the spirit, Stewart.
Spirit? Oh! I think we've got enough time for another cheer...
"Gimme a V! Gimme an I! Gimme a C-T-O-R-Y! OUT, Morganas! FLY away HOME! Our guns will make you CRY!"
We're loaded and ready for more, Captain.
Don't let our guns go quiet until Shanghai has a horizon clear of Morganas, Lieutenant.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Now that's a smiling face. How do you feel, Stewart?
Isn't it obvious? I'm thrilled! We saved a lot of civilians – families! – in Shanghai from a disaster.
Good! Now I have another question. See what's on my desk?
OH! Steamed crab! Braised pork! And is this... beggar's chicken?! It smells heavenly! And what's this? Beer!
The American Champion of the Shanghai earned a great meal and a few drinks, in her captain's professional opinion.
I couldn't possibly eat this by myself.

Fields.MenuText: Oh? Maybe I got too much for you...
Really? I've seen you pack away a lot of food. This shouldn't be a problem.
I was hoping we'd share it.

Fields.DialogueText: I have an easy solution for that!
Eating this much food isn't a problem. Eating all of this food ALONE is.
I was hoping so, too!
Grab some chopsticks and share a feast with me, Captain! This meal looks absolutely delicious.
You don't have a problem eating with your commanding officer? I don't want to stop you from being able to enjoy yourself.
That's what I'm trying to tell you...
I'm proud to call you my captain, but things feel different now. I want to call you... my friend.
Food always tastes better with friends, if you ask me.
Oh! Then the only thing I'm asking now is to get started! YUM!
